intro: Sticherus costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican sticherus, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Sticherus costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
